page.title: 17LANGUAGE
page.content: {A poem using NE of Scotland words Ma mither wis at hame fan I came hame fae skweel I asked her for a jammy piece She said " Ye muckle feel Ye can mak'it up yersel,yer nae a bairnie noo. For I'm awa ower the park,I'll hae tae feed the coo." "I'll help ye mak the dainer mam, I winder fit we'll hae. I'll pit a dumplin in the cloot,far will the rest come frae?" "Good quinie,yer a help tae me,I winna skelp yer lug The next time ye come hame up tae yer oxters in sappy dubs." Bairn = child, skweel = school, jammy piece =bread & jam, muckle feel = silly fool, park = field, cloot = cloth, quinie = girl, skelp yer lug = hit your ear, sappy dubs = sticky mud.
